author: barnabemonnot
content: can you "prove" no front-running or is it possible to mask it cleverly? does the zkEVM need to be able to detect MEV within its proof to prove that it hasn't been extracted?

author: sky.cactus
content: Transactions ordered by hash definitely does not imply no particular sequence.

author: sky.cactus
content: At best you can guarantee that naive transactions are "randomly" ordered, but this isn't particularly useful since non-naive transactions can still be ordered.

author: sky.cactus
content: I am pretty confident that none of those points can be proven.  Goodhart's Law applies here I believe.  Any automated mechanism you come up with for identifying MEV will cease to be a good mechanism for identifying MEV as soon as it matters.

author: ralexstokes
content: front-running can always be obscured in the general case so may not be foolproof, but we can imagine restricted settings where the problem is much more tractable

author: ralexstokes
content: hmm yeah proofs of mev collection inside a ZKP is pretty wild! builder bids under PBS can approximate mev oracles so can imagine getting an oracle on-chain in that setting

author: ralexstokes
content: we can definitely prove positives, may not be able to prove exclusion of negatives

author: sky.cactus
content: It feels like this would just increase the speed and liklihood of builder centralization, as now you not only have to be good at finding MEV to be competitive, but you also have to be good at *hiding* your MEV to be competitive.

author: sky.cactus
content: This raises the barrier to entry and makes existing players with existing tools and strategies have an even larger advantage against new entrants.
